author: alexdma
msg: * OntologyProvider now supports import management policies for exporting ontologies. These include MERGE, PRESERVE and FLATTEN. The PRESERVE option set by default can now set STANBOL-384 as closed.

** OntologyInpuSource<O,P> now allows to specify the storage mechanism (P - the triples provider) used for creating the source, for instance OWLOntologyManager for OWL API and TcProvider for Clerezza. If it coincides with the one used by the OntologyProvider<S> , there is no need to copy graphs from the source to the provider. As a consequence, the interface OntologyInpuSource now has methods getTriplesProvider() and getStorageKey() - with corresponding protected bind methods.

** OWLExportable interface now includes method O export(returnType) to export in formats other than OWLOntology. Can save time and memory when handling ontologies with no need for converting them. Method asOWLONtology() is deprecated but still used.
* OntologyCollector#addOntology() now returns the internal key of the ontology as managed by the OntologyProvider (STANBOL-426)
* OntoNet REST API now creates input sources by passing over the MIME type from the request header. This should speed up laoding ontologies not in RDF/XML or in some less popular format (STANBOL-422)
